result.execSummary:
The defendant David A Westmoreland Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant David A Westmoreland in court with attorney Gabriela A Leija.  Defendant David A Westmoreland in custody.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Court sentenced defendant to serve 8 MONTHS in the House of Correction CONSECUTIVE to any sentence with credit for 0 days served; STRAIGHT TIME; NO ELECTRONIC MONITORING; NO GOOD TIME ALLOWED.

Court ordered the defendant to submit a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharge.
Court ordered defendant to pay ALL COSTS and SURCHARGES by 04-13-2016 or, as a penalty if not paid, convert to a civil judgment.

Defendant David A Westmoreland in court with attorney Gabriela A Leija.  Defendant David A Westmoreland in custody.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Parties have reached a resolution. 

AS TO COUNT 1
Defendant waived rights and pled guilty.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire, Addendum, and Jury Instructions received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered.

AS TO COUNT 2
Pursuant to plea negotiations, on motion of the state, court ordered count 2 Dismissed, But Read In. 

Case adjourned to branch 24 for Sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 13, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Alexis B Stewart in court, defendant David A Westmoreland not in court, in custody.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 24.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 24, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.

Defendant David A Westmoreland in court with attorney Brian Christopher Hagner.  Defendant David A Westmoreland in custody.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 13, 2015 at 08:30 am.
NO REPLY FROM SURETY/DEFENDANT
Notice of bond forfeiture mailed to defendant; Original in file. ($500.00 signature bond) ad
Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 500.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.

Attorney Anne A. Devitt in court.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Matter before court for pretrial conference.  The defendant having failed to appear, the court ordered a bench warrant to issue, any bond forfeited and Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification by the Clerk of Circuit Court.

Defendant David A Westmoreland in court with attorney Mark Dluzak for Anne A. Devitt.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Court ordered case adjourned for pretrial conference in Branch 24.  Court ordered the defendant to possess no weapons.
No use or possession of any controlled substances without a valid prescription, Oral No Weapons Order  Pre-trial conference scheduled for 03-06-2015 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for David A Westmoreland Jr
Current: 1818 North 14th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53205   (Effective: 02-26-2015)
Prior: 1818 North 14th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53205

Defendant David A Westmoreland in court.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Protasiewicz, Branch 24.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant.
Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Defendant IS Public Defender eligible.  Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  The case is adjourned to Br.24  for a Pretrial Conference.vb
SUMMONS MAILED. DEFENDANT ORDERED INTO ROOM 221 SAFETY BUILDING ON 2/26/15 @ 1 PM
